column2: WYOMING DMV WRITTEN TEST

1. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column4: find a safe place to stop for a break.
column8: turn on the radio to keep you awake.

3. If you park facing uphill where there is NO curb, you should set the parking brake and:
column6: turn the wheels toward the curb.
column8: turn the wheels toward the edge of the road.

5. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column4: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.
column6: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 6. Roads are most slippery:
column6: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 7. Roads with double solid yellow lines in the center indicate that passing is:
column8: allowed only in your direction of travel.

column2: 8. When driving in work zones, drivers should:
column4: closely follow the driver in front of them.
column6: maintain their speed through the work zone.
column8: reduce their speed and be prepared to stop.

column2: 9. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a dip in the road. Drivers should be ready to stop if the dip is filled with water.
column8: a bridge ahead, wide enough to accommodate two lanes of traffic, but with very little clearance.

column2: 10. The road is the most slippery:
column4: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 11. A defensive driver:
column4: considers what other drivers might do and is always prepared to act.
column6: knows when it is safe to pass other vehicles.
column8: never drives below the speed limit.

column2: 12. Which of the following is NOT true about ABS?
column6: It helps increase your stopping distance.

column2: 13. This sign means:
column4: Left turns in both directions of travel are not permitted.
column8: The center lane is shared for left turns.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column4: You have the right of way

column2: 15. If you meet a stopped school bus with the lights flashing and the signal arm extended, you should:

column2: 25. You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
column4: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.

column4: always stop, whether there’s a stop sign or not.
column6: watch for children and be ready to stop.

column6: watch for workers crossing the road.

column8: put their lights on low beam.

column2: 34. What does the pictured signal indicate?

column6: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.

column2: 35. Drivers should always be looking:
column4: directly in front of the car.

38. Which statement about drinking alcohol and driving is true?
column4: Alcohol affects judgement and coordination, which are needed to drive safely.
column6: After drinking, a cold shower will sober you up.
column8: If you are under the legal BAC limit, your driving is not affected.

column8: show them how to drive defensively.

column2: 44. If you have to wait for a space to enter a freeway, you should:
column4: slow down on the ramp and search ahead for a gap in traffic on the freeway.
column6: stop at the end of the ramp to wait for a gap in traffic.
